40603789.review:
In Death propone una formula di gioco stra abusata, perfezionandone però sorprendentemente il combat system e gli elementi di contorno, che si rivelano al giocatore gradualmente all’interno di un contesto tra i migliori proposti dal genere.

Una volta avviato il gioco sarà possibile iniziare la partita nell’unica modalità ad oggi disponibile; una run single player con elementi procedurali in cui bisognerà raggiungere l’ultima stanza per sconfiggere il boss finale e proseguire nel livello successivo. Il personaggio che ci troveremo a impersonare sarà un arciere trovatosi in un purgatorio medievaleggiante che si rifà fortemente all’estetica di Dark Souls, l’unica area presente nel gioco è in particolare ispirata chiaramente alle zone gemelle della “Lost Bastille” di Dark Souls II, proposta in una variante prevalentemente diurna dalla notevole direzione artistica. L’estetica generale non è il solo richiamo ai capolavori di From Software e In Death ci propone in aggiunta sia la classica nebbia pre-boss, sia una difficoltà che tende con fierezza all’hardcore.

Iniziata la nostra run e affiancati dal nostro arco dovremmo quindi procedere di punto in punto, cercando di sopravvivere agli agguati dei nemici o tentando di prenderli di soppiatto. La varietà degli NPC non è spaventosa, ma consci di quello che il titolo propone ad oggi è sufficiente; avremo a che fare con monaci, maghi, guerrieri e zombie, ognuno con le proprie peculiarità ma generalmente non troppo svegli a livello di IA. Sarà infatti abbastanza semplice fregare i nemici solitari e quelli in piccoli gruppi, lavorando di astuzia tra il proprio movimento e i limiti dell’aggro nemico. Quando i gruppi si faranno più consistenti, invece, sarà possibile fare uso delle frecce magiche che troveremo sul nostro cammino o che potremo acquistare tramite le monete restituite dai nemici; a tal proposito i topoi del fantasy ci sono tutti, dalla freccia infuocata a quella di ghiaccio, da quella velenosa a quella multipla. Fino a qui In Death non pare nulla di nuovo o eccezionale, ma l’insieme degli elementi rende il titolo di Sòlfar un roguelike davvero soddisfacente, nonostante le attuali mancanze dovute alla natura EA del titolo. La tensione si farà palpabile già dopo una ventina di minuti grazie all’ottima atmosfera, un permadeath che non lascia nulla in mano per le partite successive e una buona gestione della proceduralità del level design.

40514306.review:
I've put a good few hours into this game now but I'm confused as to why the reviews are so positive.  It is undoubtedly a success of visual and musical design, and the core gameplay works very well, but the amount of content is sorely lacking, there is no narrative to drive the game forward and after repeating the first part of the game dozens of times it starts to become incredibly repetitive.

Without doubt, there needs to be more enemy types and more variation in the procedural generation.  Secondarily, alternative bows would go down a treat.  Such things as crossbows, horned bows, short bows, recuved bows, whatever ... just items that gave variation to the gameplay.  Lastly, there needs to be campaign of some kind rather than just this aimless Lets Get Points and See Who's Best! open-ended thing (or, if not a campaign, then at least alternative modes that aren't merely a long haul for points).

The beginnings of a great game are there, and you could say that this is what early Early Access is all about, but without a distinct roadmap of where the game is going to go it is impossible to recommend it at this price.

If you like VR archery and open-ended rogue-like games, get this.  If not, avoid, because there isn't enough there to justify the money.

39980801.review:
An excellent medieval-fantasy dungeon crawler.

Pros:
- The maps are designed using procedural generation. The map is different each time, but the overall layout is similar.
- The enemy AI will have you feeling like you're playing against real players (at times). Some enemies will avoid you and hide around obstructions instead of standing out in the open waiting to get hit.
- There are a lot of effective and fun arrow types to choose from to help you survive longer against all of the mobs.

Cons:
- Teleporting sometimes gets you stuck under buildings.

Wishlist:
- Melee combat
- Choice to have game-type where you can save your progress and revert to last checkpoint after death.

39971815.review:
This is a very satisfying roguelike. It takes a while to get used to the bow because every game has to be different. This one requires a long draw and has pretty high velocity. It takes a moment when you draw it for it to reach full power, so you can't really shoot faster than two arrows per second, which I like. The shield is fun to block with, just takes some practice to make it more reflexive. It looks and sounds great.

Locomotion is done by shooting a teleport arrow, which travels a much shorter distance than your regular arrow, or by throwing a shard an even shorter distance, or by slowly walking. I wish the walking speed was a bit faster in general and didn't slow you down when strafing or moving backwards. I think that's mostly for comfort reasons, so maybe it will get a bit more option.

You can't move while firing the bow, which I both like and dislike. I like that it makes me use all my roomscale space for dodging instead, but when I'm creeping around a corner it'd be much nicer to be able to do it with bow drawn. Enemies are fairly slow to react when they initially spot you so it's easy to run away if you turn a corner and find a big crowd.

The battles in this are a lot of fun. You have to juggle multiple enemies and balance the risk of going for the quick headshot kills with keeping them staggered as you rotate through the archers in the back taking shots while knights charge at you. The special arrows add some extra coolness. When you toggle between them the game goes in to slow motion, so it's possible to change them mid combat.

The levels are sort of procedural, but it's more like the same layouts of multiple buildings, but in a different order. I did just see one new layout, but It'd be nice to have a little more variety.

I made it to the boss on the second run, and make it there about half the time since, but haven't killed him yet. It's a fun fight.

So mostly a positive experience. I wish the sliding locomotion wasn't as constrained, a bit more variety in the levels, and for enemies to spawn in a bit sooner. If you teleport too far, in to a seemingly empty area, you might find yourself surrounded when everything spawns. But those are minor complaints compared to the fun of juggling enemies and racking up headshots and blocking and dodging, plus the roguelike progression mechanism is fun, with new powerups, bonuses, and enemies unlocking as you play.

39963697.review:
Pros:
[list]
[*]Great bow mechanic requiring precise aim
[*]Immersive atmosphere and art style.
[*]Intense combat with quick death, keeping you constantly engaged. 
[*]Challenge boss fight with many enemies.
[*]Pretty good sound design. The music fits the atmosphere and you are able to hear zombie like enemies when they are around which adds to the immersion. 
[*]Interesting movement mechanic. Personally I throw the arrow rather than shoot it 90% of the time because I find it easier. I would recommend not using the touchpad movement option because being forced to teleport to where enemies are adds to the intensity of the game. 
[/list]
Cons:
[list]
[*]Only one area, and a small subset of enemies (early access to be expected)
[*]No story
[*]Required manual edit of configs for super sampling.
[*]Can’t save a run and continue it later. (arms gets tired or life gets in the way and you have to start over)
[*]Can’t save overall progress to allow multiple people play on the same device (demo mode is a bandaid for this but doesn’t allow saving progress) 
[/list]
Overall, if you enjoy bow mechanics, intense and challenging gameplay I would recommend this.

Seltenst erstelle ich einen Kommentar für ein Spiel weil es jeder für sich herausfinden muss ob es zu einem passt und spaß macht. 
Dieses Spiel ist meines Erachtens eines der besten Games die ich seit dem Relaese der Vive gespielt habe.
Grafisch steht es über vielem was ich bisher als spielfähig gesehen habe. Damit meine ich nicht die aufpolierten "Experiences" die in der Regel mal für 15 MInuten gut sind.
Die Atmosphäre ist genial. Die Musik passt und verleiht ein leicht pessimistisch/depressives GEfühl was dem Szenario "Totenwelt" enorm viel Glaubwürdigkeit verpasst. 
Insgesamt wird es immer schwerer. Wodurch es auch nicht langweilig wird. Die Gegner werden zuweil auch hinterhältig und schleichen sich von hinten an. (manchaml Spawnen Sie dort aber auch nur ;-) )
In Summe kann ich jedem VR Spieler dieses Game als ein Muss empfehlen.

39900756.review:
There's just enough here to make this game fun.

I own a Rift, and typically continue to purchase most of my games from Steam.

In Death is a bow and arrow shoot-em-up with roguelike elements, randomly generated maps, and a few annoyingly difficult enemies.  The controls in this game are great.  A very interesting take on teleporting, which becomes nearly second nature by your third or fourth game.  Locomotion is still experimental, and one of my biggest gripes are that it's dreadfully slow.  There's no way to speed up either, so it will always end up being a combo of teleporting and locomotion in tight rooms.

The progression is nice for the first couple hours.  By now I've unlocked a good portion of the game's achievements, which also serve as marks of progression.  As the achievements are unlocked, enemies become upgraded and spawn more frequently, and different weapons/tools get added to the game.  The blocking mechanic is also surprisingly well-done, and very, very helpful.

The game is definitely in early access, so if you're looking for a full game you may want to look elsewhere.  That being said, I still believe this game is excellent for the price in its current state.  It's addictive, challenging, and makes your arms hurt like hell.  But you can't stop.  Not in the middle of a run.  Plus, it's always neat watching the map be generated right in front of you as you are about to start a new round.

39895218.review: 10/10 Game, fantastic job! Beautiful graphics, amazing gameplay, well-functioning controls, plenty of content, gorgeous soundtrack, an endless horde of enemies, and it is still in early access! So far, my favorite game for VR, even on top of Raw Data. Has sort of an "Infinity Blade" design for the castles, which is super cool. Movement is teleportation or walking. Usually I prefer to use the smooth locomotion, but the teleportation in this adds so much to the immersion, you will love it. Fire a teleport arrow out of your bow or summon a teleport crystal in your main hand, and throw it where you want to go. Incredibly unuiqe experience, just go buy it already!!!!!

39888383.review:
Very cool game that has a lot going for it, it could use some improvements(It is still in Early Acces) but overall they have done an amazing job. 
The first thing I noticed was how beautiful and crisp the graphics were and how the world felt very unique and immersive which is rare for a game with procedurally generated maps. The afterlife theme mixed with medieval architecture and baddies was very well done.
Although the game is a Rogue-like it offers progression through achievements which when completed add something to gameplay, sometimes its something that helps and sometimes something that hurts. It could be a new harder version of preexisting a bad guy, it could be a new arrow type, it could add a damage bonus to headshots, and so on. As I played and got better I advanced further with each new life, finding new areas and developing new tactics.
The bow mechanics are the best I have seen in VR yet and switching arrow types on the fly is easy and because bringing up the arrow type switching mechanic slows down time it becomes a very helpful tool to use in tough situations allowing you to dodge arrows easier and make more calculated battle decisions.
The locomotion used is also very well done, allowing you to move in 3 different ways that were each useful in different ways. You have a teleportation arrow that when shot will teleport you to whereever it strikes, this is best used for moving longer distance. You also have an orb that you can toss quickly for short to medium range teleportation, best used to quickly get out of a bad situation or to simply move behind cover without having to turn towards where you want to go. You can nock an arrow while your teleportation device is still en route to its destination and thus arrive ready to strike. The third form of locomotion is the touchpad which is very useful for poking out around corners or making small adjustments but is pretty slow so it isn't great for retreating or doing a tactical retreat luring baddies into an ambush in a spot of your choosing.
Overall I would give In Death an 8.5/10 and I have had a lot of fun playing it so far and although I am yet to beat it but it has a surprising amount of replay value and keeps bringing me back to it.
I look forward to what they will do with it while it is still in Early Access, In my opinion some things that they should do to make it even better would be:
*Add a melee weapon, maybe even just a knife so as not to take the focus away from ranged combat but to just give you something to use in a pinch.
* Difficulty levels. Having an Easy, Normal, and Hard difficulty setting would be a great way to add more replayability to the game as more experienced or better players try to master Hard difficulty and newer or worse players get to possibly beat the game on easy if they are unable to on Normal.
* A few more enemy types.
*Co-op play. I feel like this would be amazing and would really expand the audience and add replayability.
*Level Creator. I know this is a stretch but it would be so cool.
* More Statistics. I think more in depth statistics for each round and also tracking your all time statistics would be really cool.
*More achievements. People love achievements. In this case it is the only real way of making lasting "progress" in the game and more achievements means people would play more.
*More Bosses. I have only beat one boss so far because I have only had it for a couple days but I think it would make things less repetitive. Even just mini bosses with a few minions that are just a little more difficult than normal baddies and would take some strategy to defear.
*More things you can buy. Also if you could buy 1 health per shop, although that might make it too easy.
Obviously this is just a wish list and I don't expect many if any of these to be fulfilled. I think someday soon VR games will get to that level but not quite yet but this game is definitely a step in the right direction.

39881257.review:
To start with, I own a first generation HTC VIVE running on an i5 4950k and gtx 1060. While at minimal specs, this game runs flawlessly in any way you want to play it at a smooth 80-120 fps. This game has easily climbed to my top 3 of vr Favorites.

Each time you start in Purgatory, you have a new yet familiar maze ahead of you all randomly generated. After fighting your way through 3 of the main mazes with soul shops in between, You fight the boss to move on to the next even harder level. It took me about 9 or 10 runs to even get to the boss and when i was able to finally beat him after 20 or 30, It gives you the feeling of pure bliss after trial and error. Drops are completely random and will either make your day with health potions or ruin it with quivers (Which gives you ammo for specialty arrows and loves to spawn when you dont have any on you)
Each run you go through you feel more and more familiar with your bow and the teleportation and locomotion (Which you have to turn on) system making perfect for combat. achievements in the game will grant you special items in the next run making for new experiences each time as the enemies grow more experienced with you. It's the Dark Souls of VR basically and i love it. The scoreboard also gives a good sense of accomplishment seeing yourself rise with each go.

Easily a 9/10 Experience

I like to grade my reviews by starting at 5 then subtracting or adding depending on cons and pros.

5/10 for existing
+1 - Great bow mechanics
+1 - Pickups and different arrows do keep the bow mechanics fresh throughout the game
+1 - Good teleporting mechanics with an option of close range throws or long range bow shots.
+1 - Well balanced shield mechanics
+1.5 - Beautiful environments (great use of low hanging fog and particle effects)
+1 - Good use of achievements to keep the player motivated and stay as a constant variable in a rogue-like world
-1 - Low detail enemy models
-1 - No other weapon other than the bow, which is fine however it would be nice to see a sword or dagger of some sort.
-1 - No graphics settings in game (you have to edit the config file)
-0.5 - Not a huge amount of depth so far, but definitely better than lots of games out there.

Definitely worth picking up, especially considering the reasonable pricing this game has.

39844634.review:
Das erste was ich von In Death las war, dass es das Diablo in VR sein soll....nun, das ist es nicht, oder nur sehr entfernt (man hat Dungeons).
In Death ist ein Rouge-Like Bogenschützenspiel, bei dem man sich durch eine Zufallsgenerierte Welt kämpfen muss. Besiegt man Gegner, erhält man Gold und teilweise bessere Pfeile (Frost, Feuer, Nadeln...). Sobald man stirbt, wird das Level neu generiert und man fängt von vorn an.
Klingt blöd?
Isses aber nicht!

Im Grunde spielt Fortschritt im Level eher eine untergeordnete Rolle, denn es kommt nach der HighScore Liste nur darauf an, wer in einem Zug am weitesten kam. Durch die Zufallsgenerierten Level ist keine Runde wie die andere.
Die Fortbewegung erfolgt über das Werfen eines strahlenden "Dolchs" oder über das Verschießen von Teleportationspfeilen. Klingt auch doof?
Isses aber nicht!

Dadurch, dass man alles mit dem Bogen erledigt, bzw. durch das Werfen einen gewissen Flow reinbkommt, fühlt sich In Death in Kombination mit der Fantasywelt, die im Himmel herumschwebt trotzdem cool an und man kann sich am ehesten in das Szenario hineinversetzen. Wäre man nur ein Mensch und würde durch den Wald hüpfen, wäre das sicherlich etwas anderes. Hier passt das optimal und fühlt sich gut an.
Optional kann man sich zwar auch fließend bewegen, aber der Bogen/Dolch-Modus macht deutlich mehr Spass.

Was man beachten sollte ist, dass In Death kein "Kill'em all as fast as you can ratatatatata"-Spiel ist, sondern wenn man weiter kommen möchte, so muss man sich Zeit nehmen, um Ecken schauen, kleine Räume erkunden und ggf. "säubern". Denn nichts bringt einen schneller um, als ein Feind, den man hinten vergessen hat.

Abgesehen dazu ist der Soundtrack des Spiels absolut überwältigend.
Allgemein ist der Ton eine der großen Stärken des Spiels. Man kann Gegner sehr gut orten und hört man es hier und da noch schlürfen, ist man gleich besonders auf der Hut. 

Grafisch sieht es auch extrem gut aus, auch wenn hier nicht allzuviel Abwechslung geboten wird (es wird auch mal düsterer, aber im Grunde bleibt es gleich). Dies fällt aber auch nicht weiter auf, da die Architektur das herausragende ist. Die Level werden immer wunderschön generiert und man kann sich schon hier und da mal "verlaufen".

Für mich aktuell eines der besten VR-(Bogen-)Spiele, die es gibt.

Sound: 10/10
Grafik: 8/10
Gameplay: 9/10

Shoot things with a bow and try to not get shot back. Fry them, electrocute them, gas them, curse them, blow them up, hit them with your shield, teleport around them and make liberal use of bullet time (arrow time?) and roomscale. It won't be enough, you're still gonna die.

As you play the game you unlock achievements, which give you new types of arrows, upgrade your damage/hp, and add new, tougher varations of the enemies to the map. This means the progression that most games go through, where you get better weapons but harder enemies in later levels, is there throughout in later runs. So, you can jump right into the meat of the game straight away every time you play.

If this isn't enough, every time you finish a run of purgatory (3 randomly selected areas, 1 static area, and a boss), you go to the next level of purgatory, which is the same thing but with upgraded enemies. Get to deeper levels of purgatory and you open gates that let you skip directly to them. Point is, if you want an archery game that you can just pick up and it instantly delivers fun, challenging gameplay with a minimum of fuss, this is it.

39812469.review:
This is a legitimately awesome game, that just so happens to also be beautifully constructed for VR. The setting and theme work well.

At the time when I tested it, it had a fairly curious learning curve, at some points getting intensely frustrating.

But the beauty is that the core mechanics are so well crafted, so rewarding that the game will pull you back in despite the frustration, and you will get better, and in doing so, reap the rewards of a hard fought victory.

I actually nearly gave up on the game immediately before they had implemented the free locomotion mechanic - the bow teleport and the shard throw aren't bad... but they take away from the sort of immediacy and reliability of normal teleportation mechanics and exacerbate a difficult game.

But, I came back due to the keen presentation... and eventually learned to love the bow and shard teleport mechanics - it's really quite unique, with both of them been among my favourite supplementary locomotion techniques in VR to date! 

The weight and feeling of the shard throw (which I call the dagger teleport; because that's what it feels like you're throwing) is just one of the most tactile experiences that VR currently offers... because a dagger is about the weight of a vive controller. A subtle variation in the flick of the wrist will cause you to teleport in a dramatically different location - and once you learn to feel it out, becomes an awesome sensation; as you casually flick around corners, doors, archways and down the corridor, while also shooting zombies (abominations), hooded death monks and knights in their damn faces!

With more games of this quality level, VR will be sure to become the dominant medium of gaming in the years to come.

If you're at all a fan of the bow shooting or the rogue lite genres, do yourself a favour and pick this one up.

Thoroughly recommended.

39811814.review:
Let me start by saying I was a beta tester and got the game for free when it released to early access.

The gameplay has really been polished. It's hard, but a few hours in and you'll be loading arrows and firing without barely looking at the bow. It demands a level of focus and coordination that few VR games do, this becomes especially apparent after your first few deaths. Just to load the arrows you need to be relatively closer to the bow string than most games with a bow. The enemies are a joy to take down and the placement is generated from a seed each session.

The only thing in my mind that is holding it back is the lack of level variety, 14 hours in and I'd like some new sights as I take on tougher versions of knights, archers, and monsters with new types of arrows. The achievement based progress system is very nice, especially your first 5-6 hours in as you see your abilities and options grow, but at the same time new tougher enemies are unlocked. Perhaps the game could use a few more enemies too.

I think this is one of the few VR games where I feel like it's system is all in place and polished, it just needs more variety in levels/environment. Once they've added that in and new bosses then you'll see people putting 40+ hours into this game. I don't want to hype things beyond your imagination, it currently has one boss and about 5 different layouts to it's gothic architecture themed levels so not quiet as procedurally generated on that front. There are about 10 special types of arrows, and 3 types of enemies with several variations you can unlock as you play. It has both teleport and joypad/stick locomotion, and it's done right. Right now it's very score focused, but that'll certainly change as new content and challenges are added so a stronger story element is there for those that need it. The replayability is already there and is only going to grow.

14 hours in with a wealth of special arrows unlocked, rushing into a room and blasting away can still get me easily killed. I'm not saying I haven't done so and survived, but it's the kind of thing that will deplete your arrow supply and leave you taking on the boss in the worse condition.

I'm not going to say whether the game is worth the price our not, after all I got it for free, but I think the game represents what many of us would like to see more of in our VR games. This game has got me playing in VR daily this past month always trying to best my last session, something most VR games can't get me to do.

39790912.review:
I must say I’m quite impressed! I like VR archery games and have quite a few hours in QuiVR, Holopoint, and Twisted Arrow. After 3 runs I must say In Death well deserves attention of anyone who enjoys VR bow games. 

The game looks gorgeous. Environments are beautiful, enemies look detailed and realistic, the music score is excellent as well. This is likely the most polished Early Access game I’ve played yet. 

The game uses procedural maps to give you a new map each run which certainly helps replayability. After death you earn achievements which both improve your abilities and make enemies stronger to maintain a great challenge. This is one leaderboard I want to climb on for sure. 

You can find or buy special arrows that set enemies on fire/freeze them/shoot multiple arrows and such. You can block arrow shots/melee hits with a shield. I’d love to see a shortsword added for when an enemy gets in your face. 

I generally am not a fan of teleport games and much prefer artificial locomotion. The good news is artificial locomotion is available in the settings and works well enough though it’s s bit slow for my taste for game balance reasons I imagine. For my first run I went ahead and tried the default movement scheme to experience the game the way developers intended. After 5 minutes I was very comfortable with it and after 10 it felt like second nature. The way it works is when you pull on your bowstring with trigger you shoot a regular arrow as you’d expect. When you pull on the bowstring with touchpad (on your non-bow hand) you instead shoot a teleport arrow. It’s extremely fluid and works well. If you press the non-bow hand touchpad away from the bowstring you can throw a teleport dagger instead. If you turn on artificial movement you keep both teleport abilities so you can combine all 3 to your heart’s content. That’s my preferred way now. 

After my first death the game only got better as new enemies made it even more challenging on the next runs. 

Overall I’m very impressed. This could easily be released as a finished product but since devs want to keep adding content that’s even better. Can’t wait to jump back on tonight.

39789076.review:
First thing I thought was 'not another VR Archery game'... So I checked out some videos and guides and my interest peaked enough to try it.

And glad I did! 

The pace feels just right, the team must have put some love and care into this. Archery mechanics are spot on. Going into the fray you have complete control for each and all fights with the 'bullet time' ability, meaning for VR you can go into it guns blazing or take your time safely picking them off looking around corners. When you shoot an enemey the arrow sticks into them and they recoil in a different way depending on where you hit them. Making for interesting combat as you can slow 'em down long enough to switch targets momentarily. 

Also most importantly for me the AI moves and paths correctly, moving organically and idling/patroling nicely. I found with other archery games I become immediately disconnected when the minions clip incorrectly on the level or bug out or are just too obviously stupid to keep me interested. 

Graphics are nice, Gothic setting is what sold me into trying it and does not disappoint.

Sound effects are fantastic, arrows wizz past your ear, emenies make different noises so you can safely identify if one has appeared in your area. Gregorian style music plays in the background, amplifying the presense of a haunted Cathederal.

Gold is earnt by picking off enemies, you can spend it on shops that divide the three zones before the boss. Items and achievements keep it interesting as they grant permanent buffs as well as poweful consumables. 

Before playing this or If your on the fence read this Guide!:

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1288050163

And the advanced guide (not required):

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1288069185

Things I would like:

- More interesting Gothic worlds (Think Vermintide - fantastic example of immersive level design)
- Maybe some more loot (such as hidden gold chests)
- Multiplayer!

In Death war schon in der Beta sehr schnell eines meiner Lieblingsspiele. Es gibt wohl kein VR-Spiel, bei dem das "Nur noch eine Runde.. verdammt!" so gut funktioniert. 39787281.review:
Ziel von In Death ist es, uns als Bogenschütze bis zu einem Boss durchzukämpfen und diesen zu legen. Was einfach klingt entpuppt sich als nervenaufreibende Herausforderung.
Nach einem kurzen Tutorial werden wir auch schon in ein zufällig generiertes Dungeon geworfen. Bewaffnet mit Bogen und Schild kämpfen wir uns langsam gegen verschiedene Gegnertypen vorran. Während zu Beginn noch langsame "Zombies" auf uns zuwanken und Mönche uns vereinzelt beschießen, steigt der Schwierigkeitsgrad mit jedem Meter. Im weiteren Verlauf bekommen wir es mit gepanzerten Rittern und Bogenschützen mit Mehrfachpfeilen und anderem zu tun. 
Während unserer Tour sammeln wir fleißig Gold und Loot von erledigten Gegnern ein, um uns auf den Endkampf vorzubereiten. Durch das Freischalten von Erfolgen verstärken wir unseren Helden zusätzlich, wie z.B. mehr Schaden bei Kopftreffern und ähnliches.
Für unser Gold können wir uns sowohl heilen (angebracht, da man nur 1 Leben besitzt, Permadeath) und uns mit Spezialpfeilen ausrüsten, die Gegner in Brand setzten, einfrieren, explodieren uvm.
Zur Fortbewegung dient sowohl ein Teleportationspfeil als auch freie Bewegung. Per Teleportationspfeilen können wir uns über Dächer bewegen oder schnell einer Überzahl Gegnern entkommen. Zum Blocken herannahender Pfeile wechseln wir per schnellem Tastendruck auf unser Schild oder werfen einen Miniblitz, um uns aus der direkten Schußlinie zu porten.. Nahkampf ist nicht vorgesehen, also immer schön Abstand halten.
Das Wechseln der Pfeile erfolgt ebenfalls über einen einfachen Knopfdruck und geht mit etwas Übung grandios. Allgemein ist die Steuerung ein großes Plus des Spiels. Sowohl das Zielen mit dem Bogen als auch das Wechseln der Pfeile und der schnelle Einsatz des Schildes zum Blocken funktionieren einwandfrei.
Abwechslung ist dank der zufällig generierten Welt gegeben, und auch wenn das Spielprinzip simpel klingt, denkt man sich nach jeder Runde, ach komm, 1x geht noch. Das Spiel ist zwar nicht einfach, aber man hat immer das Gefühl, selbst Mist gebaut zu haben, wenn man stirbt. Es wirkt nicht "unfair", aber fordernd.
Unsere Leistung können wir anhand eines Scoreboards mit dem Rest der Welt vergleichen,
Die Grafik macht einen guten Eindruck, es läuft permanent sehr flüssig, hat keinerlei Aussetzer oder Spielabbrüche.
Die Steuerung ist einfach nur gut und durchdacht, da gibt es nichts zu bemängeln.
Auf jeden Fall eine runde Spielerfahrung die Lust auf mehr macht.

Gruß Ziffi

39786269.review:
I own pretty much every credible SteamVR archery game on the market at the moment and always find something to enjoy in any of them, so the idea of an archery roguelike was very compelling.  From the get go, the archery physics in this game are second to none - this even beats QuiVR in my opinion.  The idea of using archery as a movement mechanic sounds really awful in theory, but in practice.... they've really made it work here.

The gameplay is excellent, the difficulty is somewhere between "brutal" and "f*** you hahahahaha" (an essential feature of any roguelike), and everything else from the atmosphere to the random level generation is very polished, especially for an EA game.  I'd personally like to see some more RPG/levelling elements and the ability to save progress and pick it up later, but even without those features this is more than worth the money.

If you like roguelikes, buy this game.  If you like VR archery games, buy this game.  If you like roguelikes *and* VR archery games, you'll have no regrets picking this one up.

39781624.review: A killer app for VR!  We finally have a game with decent progression and replay value that has been built for VR!  This is essentially a dungeon crawler with procedurally generated levels.  You are equipped with a bow and a shield with a vast selection of different arrow heads to choose from, offering some exciting verity for how you go about clearing each cell.  While the game does center around teleportation, smooth movement is offered as well and you will actually find yourself barely using it.   The graphical quality has been optimized quite nicely and the atmosphere of the art style really reals you in.  My only real complaint for this game is the lack of throwing knives.  It almost seems like they're supposed to exist since you have both a teleportation arrow and a teleportation shard, but only lethal arrows.  If you are ok with being restricted to archery then buy this now!

39781455.review:
Seriously impressed with my first two runs.  First the gameplay.  The game is both tough and skillful.  Everytime I got hit I felt it was my fault..  The enemies felt polished and clever.  It's the little things, like the hitboxes being super tight, enemies who are hit can move to the side to mess up your next shot, or who teleport to you if you try to run.  I was looking at each new bit of a terrain as a puzzle.

Game looks great.  There is something satisfying about seeing a high point ahead and finally cutting your way up there.  

I like the rogue like elements and hope they include more. 

I'd say this game is now the best bow/arrow game out now.  Closest comparison is Twisted Arrow, and it's much more interesting and dynamic than that.

39780114.review:
Highlights:
 - Best VR game I own
 - Unique setting, fantastic graphics, immersive sound design, addictive gameplay
 - Closest thing to a Dark Souls VR you'll find
 
Specs:  Vive/Roomscale/i7-7700K/1080ti/32GB
 
Disclosure:  Beta test participant since mid-December. I revoked the Steam key and purchased the Early Access version so my review would count in Steam rankings.

Review:
 
I normally don't post reviews, but the quality of this game deserves it.  I have a modest VR library (50 or so titles) with an FPS bias.  I've spent far more hours playing In Death than any other title I own  ...  and that's just the beta version.  In my view, the gameplay is already mostly perfected and all that is needed is level content.  

Pros:
- Addictive gameplay.  You're an archer in the afterlife and everything wants to kill you.  Bring it!  The bow and arrow mechanics are well tuned, and your survival is tied directly to your skill, not luck.  Teleportation and free locomotion movement plus the fact that you can go anywhere that you can see creates endless options for tactical combat ranging from Super Cautious Long Distance Sniper to In Your Face Ninja Assassin.  Randomly generated interconnected floating islands populated with gothic architecture provides a great arena for afterlife mayhem.  Fact:  taking down enemies with perfect face shots never gets old.

- Unique setting, superb graphics, immersive sound design.  Floating islands of gothic architecture is just cool.  Enemies (monks, knights, abominations) are detailed and superbly animated.  The music helps establish the surreal atmosphere, while the sound effects are excellent.  The meaty thunk of a head shot is a beautiful thing.

- Channels the Dark Souls Mojo like nobody's business. This game is (really) hard, but fair. Be prepared to die, a lot. Enemies scale in difficulty as you play via an achievement system which moves the challenge bar upwards. However, the game never feels unfair and it manages to trigger the "must try just one more time" urge with impressive consistency.          

Cons
- As one might expect from an early access title, there is somewhat limited content. You can proceed through an apparently infinite number of randomly generated levels, but at this point, there is a strong similarity between levels.  However, prepare to spend a significant amount of time building the skills necessary to just finish the first level.
  
- No multiplayer yet

- The bow is your only weapon that can take down enemies (you also have a shield that can block arrows and bash opponents backwards).  Personally, I'd like to see a melee weapon added eventually.

Bottom line:  I've had a blast so far with In Death, the price provides excellent value for the money, and I really can't wait to see the full game.

39779597.review:
自由移動できる死後の世界が舞台のローグライク弓ゲー。敵を倒す、あるいは避けながらボスのいる区画まで行って倒すというシンプルな流れです。ボス前のアレとかダクソっぽい雰囲気がＧＯＯＤ！以下、説明が下手なんで箇条書きで特徴を

・弓の操作感は「The Bow」と同様に快適
・盾で敵の攻撃を防いだり、叩いて相手を怯ませたりできる
・区画の構造はある程度決まっていてそれがランダムで組み合わさって自動生成される
・移動はフリーロコモーション、ナイフのようなものを移動したい場所へ手で投げる特殊ワープ移動の２通り、弓で撃った場所へワープすることも可能
・回復アイテム、特殊効果弓(個性があって面白い)を敵がドロップ、ショップでも購入可能
・死ぬと最初からやり直しだが豊富な実績アンロックによって体力の最大値up、弓の威力や性能upなど底上げされていく、、が敵も種類や数が増えたりする
・ランキングボードあり

最初は怒り爆発の難しさでダクソ並みに「心が折れそうだ、、」となりましたが自分のヘッドショットスキルが向上、アンロックによる底上げ、敵の特徴や特殊弓の使い時が分かってくると戦略の幅も広がって自分のスキル向上を実感しつつ進められるように。マゾ仕様ながら妙な中毒性があります。移動方式はナイフ投げがオススメです。慣れてくると意外に快適で前を見つつ後ろに投げて後方移動しながら攻撃したり、手首でスナップ効かせて真っ直ぐ投げることで高速移動などできます。
試行錯誤しながらやっていくのが楽しいゲームですが、なかなかボスまで辿り着けない方は、[spoiler] なるべく敵を一体ずつ誘い出して倒し、大勢に気付かれたら追って来なくなるまで全力ワープ逃げるとかなり生存率上がるかと[/spoiler]

弓ゲーに自信ありの方は是非！太陽万歳！

39779585.review: I'm a big fan of roguelikes so I was very excited for this game when I first heard about it. The level rebuilds itself differently along with enemies after each death / run. As you progress through the game and get "achievements" you receive permanent upgrades (some "downgrades" too such as tougher enemies). As a VR game it plays really well unlike many of the games released for VR. The movement system involves either shooting a teleport arrow to where you wish to go, or throwing a shard for short ranged movement. At first I thought this was an odd concept but when I played the game it felt right. You also can buy items at shops that are also randomly generated. As for the enemies, they all have their own abilities and need to be approached differently (some enemies attack from afar, some charge at you, etc.) The changes I've seen the game go through before it's early access release (I was in the closed test) makes me confident this game will be even greater when it leaves early access, I recommend this game especially if you are looking for a good roguelike game made for VR.

39778960.review: Awesome game. Really shows the potential of VR in this game type.

39777890.review:
Not bad for early access but many things to fix and upgrade. I bring up some pros and cons after 35 minutes of playing.

Pros
- nice music, creating the perfect mood, and atmosphere for this kind of game
- randomly placed play areas make it more interesting and not so repeating
- graphics are nice but definitely could be better
- bow mechanics are nice and easy, works well and feels well. Different arrow types is a nice touch.
- free locomotion is must be and you have it here

Cons

- why and why no graphical settings? Why no supersampling settings? It should be must be because some people have very powerful pc-s as mine and I want to tweaks SS or something As generally, graphics look nice, its far from very good because there is some degree blurriness and I dont like it. It should be nice and clear as lots of games are. Please make it, so I can crank it up as high as possible.
- it feels somehow repetitive because there are very similar buildings and rooms and only 3 different type of enemies so far. Maybe I didn't play long enough, will see.
- the AI does not seem very good, but it's not bad either. Should be better!

So far, generally positive game but hope to see more and graphical tweakings possibility and more content. It seems to be high-quality game what it has already.
39777890.developer_response:
There is a way to tweak graphic settings through an ini file, but we will expose this in an in-game menu soon. To tweak screen percentage, you can go into the file called Game.ini that you will in the folder:

<user directory>\AppData\Local\InDeath\Saved\Config\WindowsNoEditor

and tweak the value of r.ScreenPercentage to whatever value your hardware supports. 

Regarding variability of surroundings, if you are in offline mode (i.e. not connected to leaderboards and such) there is currently a bug where the same random seed is being used. Fix for this is imminent.

Hope that helps!

39777200.review:
＜2/14追記＞
アプデによりオプションで右タッチパッドによる回転が可能に。
その場でヌルっと回転するので非常に酔う…。
気のせいかもしれませんが、敵のアイテムドロップ率が上がった気がします。
（それでも死にまくりますが）

高難易度モードが追加。
サンクチュアリにある炎の窓？からいけますが、
通常モードよりかなりキツイです…全然生き残れません。
----------------------------------------------------------
＜2/7追記＞
オプションのロコモーションをONにすることにより、
左タッチパッドにて歩行移動が可能。
ゆっくりしか移動できないが、戦闘時の立ち位置微調整に使える。
※柱や角のカバーに隠れながらの射撃がやりやすくなります。
----------------------------------------------------------
EVEREST VRの開発元だけあってグラフィックは綺麗です。

ゲームを開始すると移動や戦闘についてのチュートリアル開始。
移動はテレポートのみだが、よくある移動先をマーキングするタイプではなく、弓で移動先を撃つか羽？を投げてその先に移動する二つの方法がある。
敵から距離を取る場合は羽を投げて探索時は弓で移動かな。

ゲームは立位だけでなく、座位でも遊べます。
弓引き動作があるので背凭れがあるとちょっとやりにくいかも。
回転方法はグリップボタンで行い、右コントローラーで右回転、左コントローラーで左回転。
シールドを使おうとして焦ると回転することが稀にあり。
設定でトリガーとグリップボタンの入れ替えができるといいかも。

城の中を探索して進むのですが、敵の角待ちが結構多い。
索敵能力が高いので怪しい場所があったら移動前に弓を撃つと反応して敵が出てきます。

攻撃手段は弓のみなので接近されるとキツイ。
シールドで殆どの攻撃を防ぐことはできるのですが、
使用中は視野が塞がれてしまい、状況確認が難しい。
シールドバッシュによる敵の「よろけ」時間がかなり長いので、
接近された場合は積極的に使用していく。

矢には特殊矢があり、敵が落とすかショップ購入で入手できる。
手に入れた場合はケチらずに使用することを薦めます。
（死んだら残りませんので実績解除のつもりで。）

マップはある程度規則性のあるランダム生成型。
その為か開始直後に敵が大量に固まっていたりと最初から高難易度な場合がある。
似たような景色が長く続くので正しい道へ進んでいるのかよくわからない。

ショップの物価が全体的に高額。
敵一体倒しても60～90gold程度なのに回復１目盛りで2000goldとかもうね…。
特殊矢や回復は一度購入すると売り切れ状態になる。

戦闘実績があり、解除していくと攻撃力アップなどボーナスがある。
やりこみ要素があるのは良いのですが、戦闘が弓のみなので繰り返しプレイが苦痛に感じる。
矢がホント狙い通りに飛んでいかないのよ…ヘッドショットが決まると気持ちいいのですが。

タイトル通り結構な「死にゲー」です。
※死亡すると初めから再スタート。
高難易度なので繰り返しプレイが耐えられる人にお勧めします。

39776633.review:
This is an actually difficult randomly generated dungeon crawler. It's a lot like Kartong but I like In Death more. 
It has an arcade like nature, you always start over again but with lots of unlocks between the runs. The gnarly difficulty and global highscore makes it highly addictive.
Graphics, performance and stability are great. Sólfar should teach Bethesda on how to do this.
I absolutely recommend this game. Dodging arrows in roomscale VR is fun ;)

39773651.review:
2 Minute Video Review → https://youtu.be/A7XyueAmkEM

In Death is a bow & arrow dungeon crawler set in the afterlife.

It features a unique movement system that allows you to teleport either by firing a special arrow at the ground, or (using your other hand) tossing a teleport shard. There is a setting for sliding locomotion as well.

Your only weapon is a bow & arrow, but you’ll gain specialty arrows as you progress. For blocking attacks you can quickly activate your shield with your bow hand by holding down trigger, after you release the trigger your bow returns.

Each time you play the levels are procedurally generated so you’ll never play the same level twice. 

The overall design is beautiful. The level architecture is a giant cathedral, with Gregorian chant music to match. And speaking of audio, the sound design is also very well done. The game doesn’t blast you with constant audio, you can listen in and hear if an enemy is around the corner, or if an arrow narrowly misses you.

The whole experience is exceptionally well polished and challenging. If you’re looking for a fresh new bow & arrow dungeon crawler, then I recommend it.
